poem:
**Shifting Gears**

When Zipcar zips its final zip,  
London lanes sigh with space,  
while Free2Move muse on maps and gaps,  
their engines purring patience.  
Behind steering wheels, dreams idle,  
dashboards blink new possibilities  
in tepid urban mist,  
as city streets hum future paths,  
await the next driver,  
await the next shift.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Zipcar’s rivals consider London expansion after it reveals UK exit Several car-sharing companies are considering launching or expanding in London, with the imminent closure of Zipcar’s UK operation leaving a large gap in the market in one of Europe’s biggest cities. Free2Move, owned by the carmaker Stellantis, said it was “closely monitoring the London market”, and “actively assessing” options for its services. It already operates fleets in cities including Berlin, Paris, Rome and Washington DC.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Zipcar’s rivals consider London expansion after it reveals UK exit Several car-sharing companies are considering launching or expanding in London, with the imminent closure of Zipcar’s UK operation leaving a large gap in the market in one of Europe’s biggest cities. Free2Move, owned by the carmaker Stellantis, said it was “closely monitoring the London market”, and “actively assessing” options for its services. It already operates fleets in cities including Berlin, Paris, Rome and Washington DC.
